page.title: 02Coxheath Junior School
page.content:
Coxheath Junior School was built in 1963 and opened in 1964 as a joint Junior and Infant school. The Infants broke away in 1974 when a new separate building opened. When the Junior School opened there were 100 pupils in total compared with 227 Junior children in 1985.
At present (July 1985) there are eight classes, two for each of four year age groups.The layout of the school is basically in a 'T' shape, with four rooms forming each of the two arms and a hall at the junction of the two. The full range of curriculum subjects is taught and there is a wide range of extra-curricular activities. In 1985 the boys' football team tied for first place in the Maidstone area seven-a-side competition.
